page.title: 15Uley Primary School.
page.content: Uley Primary School was built about 1855 with land and finance given by a local mill owner,Mary Sheppard. The school has approximately 100 children on roll in 1985. There are at present 4 full time teachers,including the Headteacher,and one part-time remedial teacher.Other staff include a cook,a kitchen assistant,two lunchtime supervisors,a cleaner and a crossing patrol lady. The children attending the school are of both sexes and the age range is from 4 to 11. At eleven,the children transfer to the local comprehensive school. Our school has four classes. The reception and second year infants make up Class 1. Second and third year infants make up Class 2. First and second year juniors make up Class 3,and third and fourth year juniors Class 4. The number on roll is expected to decline in future.
